data_structures: binary tree node with parent pointer
algorithm_technique: Iterative traversal from leaf to root, re-parenting nodes and adjusting child pointers.
problem_summary_simple: Reroot a binary tree so a given leaf node becomes the new root, adjusting parent-child relationships.
problem_summary_technical: Iteratively traverses from the leaf node up to the original root, modifying parent and child pointers to restructure the tree.
key_insights: The key is to correctly manage parent and child pointers during the rerooting process.
The process involves swapping the parent-child relationship for each node on the path from the leaf to the root.
Ensuring parent pointers are updated correctly is crucial for a valid tree structure.
